entries.name: Vessel
entries.description: Represents a vessel in the game. All vessels share suffixes inherited from Orbitable. Use SHIP to refer to the vessel running the script.
entries.snippet:
SET myVessel TO SHIP.
PRINT myVessel:NAME.

entries.name: ALTITUDE
entries.description: The altitude above sea level of the vessel in meters.
entries.snippet: PRINT "Altitude: " + ROUND(SHIP:ALTITUDE) + "m".

entries.name: APOAPSIS
entries.description: The apoapsis of the vessel's current orbit in meters above sea level. Returns a very large number if the orbit is hyperbolic.
entries.snippet: PRINT "Apoapsis: " + ROUND(SHIP:APOAPSIS/1000) + "km".

entries.name: PERIAPSIS
entries.description: The periapsis of the vessel's current orbit in meters above sea level.
entries.snippet: PRINT "Periapsis: " + ROUND(SHIP:PERIAPSIS/1000) + "km".

entries.name: CREW
entries.description: Returns a list of all Kerbal crew members currently aboard this vessel.

entries.name: THROTTLE
entries.description: The current throttle setting from 0.0 to 1.0. Can be set to control thrust.
entries.snippet: SET SHIP:CONTROL:PILOTMAINTHROTTLE TO 0.5.

entries.name: LOCK
entries.description: Creates a binding that continuously updates the identifier every physics tick. Commonly used for steering and throttle control. The expression is re-evaluated each tick.
entries.snippet:
LOCK STEERING TO PROGRADE.
LOCK THROTTLE TO 1.

entries.name: UNLOCK
entries.description: Releases a previously locked variable, stopping the continuous re-evaluation. Use UNLOCK ALL to release all locks.
entries.snippet:
UNLOCK STEERING.
UNLOCK ALL.

entries.name: ABS
entries.description: Returns the absolute value of a number.
entries.snippet: PRINT ABS(-5). // Outputs: 5

entries.name: ROUND
entries.description: Rounds a number to a specified number of decimal places. If decimals is omitted, rounds to the nearest integer.
entries.snippet:
PRINT ROUND(3.14159, 2). // Outputs: 3.14
PRINT ROUND(2.7). // Outputs: 3

entries.name: SQRT
entries.description: Returns the square root of a number.
entries.snippet: PRINT SQRT(16). // Outputs: 4

entries.name: STEERING
entries.description: A special variable that controls the vessel's attitude. Lock it to a direction (like PROGRADE, RETROGRADE, or a custom direction) to have the autopilot point the ship.
entries.snippet:
LOCK STEERING TO PROGRADE.
WAIT 5.
LOCK STEERING TO HEADING(90, 45).

entries.name: THROTTLE
entries.description: A special variable that controls the vessel's throttle. Lock it to a value between 0.0 (no thrust) and 1.0 (full thrust).
entries.snippet:
LOCK THROTTLE TO 1.0.
WAIT UNTIL SHIP:APOAPSIS > 80000.
LOCK THROTTLE TO 0.

entries.name: PROGRADE
entries.description: A direction pointing along the vessel's orbital velocity vector. The direction the vessel is moving in orbit.
entries.snippet: LOCK STEERING TO PROGRADE.

entries.name: RETROGRADE
entries.description: A direction pointing opposite to the vessel's orbital velocity. Used for deceleration burns.
entries.snippet:
LOCK STEERING TO RETROGRADE.
LOCK THROTTLE TO 1.
WAIT UNTIL SHIP:VELOCITY:ORBIT:MAG < 100.

entries.name: STAGE
entries.description: Activates the next stage, just like pressing the spacebar in KSP. Use STAGE:READY to check if staging is available.

entries.name: WAIT
entries.description: Pauses script execution. WAIT n pauses for n seconds. WAIT UNTIL pauses until a condition becomes true.
entries.snippet:
WAIT 5.
WAIT UNTIL SHIP:ALTITUDE > 10000.
WAIT UNTIL ETA:APOAPSIS < 30.

entries.name: WHEN
entries.description: Sets up a trigger that fires once when the condition becomes true. Use PRESERVE inside the block to make it fire again on subsequent true evaluations.

entries.name: HEADING
entries.description: Creates a direction from compass heading (0=north, 90=east) and pitch (0=horizontal, 90=straight up). Essential for launch guidance.
entries.snippet:
LOCK STEERING TO HEADING(90, 80). // East at 80 degrees pitch
WAIT UNTIL SHIP:ALTITUDE > 1000.
LOCK STEERING TO HEADING(90, 45). // Gravity turn

entries.name: Body
entries.description: Represents a celestial body (planet or moon). Access via SHIP:BODY or by name (e.g., KERBIN, MUN, DUNA).
entries.snippet:
PRINT SHIP:BODY:NAME.
PRINT KERBIN:RADIUS.
PRINT MUN:MU.

entries.name: RADIUS
entries.description: The radius of the celestial body in meters, measured from the center to sea level.
entries.snippet: PRINT KERBIN:RADIUS. // 600000 meters

entries.name: MU
entries.description: The gravitational parameter (G*M) of the body in m^3/s^2. Used in orbital calculations.
entries.snippet:
// Calculate orbital velocity at altitude
SET r TO KERBIN:RADIUS + SHIP:ALTITUDE.
SET v TO SQRT(KERBIN:MU / r).
PRINT "Orbital velocity: " + ROUND(v) + " m/s".

entries.name: PRINT
entries.signature: PRINT expression. | PRINT expression AT (col, row).
entries.description: Outputs text to the terminal. Can optionally specify screen position with AT clause.
entries.snippet:
PRINT "Hello, Kerbal!".
PRINT "Altitude: " + ROUND(SHIP:ALTITUDE).
PRINT "Status" AT (0, 0).

entries.name: SET
entries.description: Assigns a value to a variable. Creates the variable if it doesn't exist. Unlike LOCK, the value is evaluated once at assignment time.
entries.snippet:
SET x TO 5.
SET myAlt TO SHIP:ALTITUDE.
SET targetApo TO 100000.

entries.name: List
entries.description: An ordered collection of items. Supports indexing with [n], iteration with FOR, and methods like ADD, REMOVE, LENGTH.
entries.snippet:
SET myList TO LIST().
myList:ADD("item1").
myList:ADD("item2").
PRINT myList[0]. // "item1"
PRINT myList:LENGTH. // 2

FOR item IN myList {
  PRINT item.
}

entries.name: PARTS
entries.description: Returns a list of all parts on the vessel.

entries.name: RESOURCES
entries.description: Returns a list of all resources on the vessel.

entries.name: ETA
entries.description: Structure providing estimated time to orbital events. Access via ETA:APOAPSIS, ETA:PERIAPSIS, ETA:TRANSITION.
entries.snippet:
PRINT "Time to apoapsis: " + ROUND(ETA:APOAPSIS) + "s".
WAIT UNTIL ETA:APOAPSIS < 30.

entries.name: APOAPSIS
entries.description: Time in seconds until reaching apoapsis.
entries.snippet:
WAIT UNTIL ETA:APOAPSIS < 30.
LOCK STEERING TO PROGRADE.
LOCK THROTTLE TO 1.

entries.name: Vector
entries.description: A 3D vector with X, Y, Z components. Used for positions, velocities, and directions. Create with V(x,y,z) function.
entries.snippet:
SET myVec TO V(1, 2, 3).
PRINT myVec:MAG. // magnitude
PRINT myVec:NORMALIZED. // unit vector
SET result TO myVec + V(1, 0, 0). // vector addition

entries.name: MAG
entries.description: The magnitude (length) of the vector.
entries.snippet:
SET velocity TO SHIP:VELOCITY:ORBIT.
PRINT "Speed: " + ROUND(velocity:MAG) + " m/s".
